availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edmund Swinford (Harrison County, KY, laborer and farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Matthew Swinford and Frances Swinford. Married to Frances Hedger Swinford in Harrison County, Kentucky, on September 13, 1852. Father of Mary Swinford, Ann Swinford, James T. Swinford, and John F. Swinford. Laborer in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 151A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 528-29.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Leesburg Precinct, p. 207A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216896.
